page.title: 11BARNSTAPLE JUNCTION STATION.
page.content: Barnstaple had three{stations}once. Nowadays it has one,the Barnstaple junction{station.}It was opened in 1854.The first diesel service started in 1964,before then all trains ran on steam. At present the{station}has eleven trains every week day.The line goes from Barnstaple to Exeter stopping at eleven village{stations}on the way.It is mostly single track although there are double tracks laid these are not used.Another line went from Barnstaple to Bideford but the track was taken up in 1985 because it was considered uneconomical. This line may now be used as a footpath or cycle track.A British rail employee believes that the loss of this line will lead to inconvenience and unemployment and will put more cars on the road.The line to Exeter is also threatened which would be a more serious blow.
